intro: Pachygone vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis Pachygone, is a unique flowering plant native to the island of Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
